metadata.title: CVE-2023-47233 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.description:
The brcm80211 component in the Linux kernel through 6.5.10 has abrcmf_cfg80211_detach use-after-free in the device unplugging (disconnectthe USB by hotplug) code. For physically proximate attackers with localaccess, this "could be exploited in a real world scenario." This is relatedto brcmf_cfg80211_escan_timeout_worker indrivers/net/wireless/broadcom/brcm80211/brcmfmac/cfg80211.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-47233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-35-generic - 6.5.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-35-generic - 6.5.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-35-generic-64k - 6.5.0-35.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1020-aws - 6.5.0-1020.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1021-azure - 6.5.0-1021.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1020-gcp - 6.5.0-1020.20
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1016-laptop - 6.5.0-1016.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-35-lowlatency - 6.5.0-35.35.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-35-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-35.35.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1023-oracle - 6.5.0-1023.23
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1023-oracle-64k - 6.5.0-1023.23
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1017-raspi - 6.5.0-1017.20
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1014-starfive - 6.5.0-1014.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-35.35').
linux-aws package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1020.20').
linux-azure package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1021.22').
linux-gcp package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1020.20').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-laptop package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1016.19').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-35.35.1').
linux-oracle package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1023.23').
linux-raspi package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1017.20').
linux-starfive package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1014.15').
